headline: SAN FRANCISCO SUPERVISORS DEMAND AMAZON BARGAIN WITH THE TEAMSTERS
summary: The San Francisco Board of Supervisors unanimously passed a resolution today demanding that Amazon immediately begin bargaining with more than 100 warehouse workers and drivers at the company's DCK6 facility. The vote followed a rally and intense advocacy by Amazon Teamsters calling out the company's ongoing refusal to recognize the union.

The vote followed a rally and intense advocacy by Amazon Teamsters calling out the company's ongoing refusal to recognize the union.

headline: JBG SMITH Declares a Quarterly Common Dividend of $0.175 Per Share
summary: BETHESDA, Md., December 16, 2025--JBG SMITH (NYSE: JBGS), a leading owner, operator, and developer of mixed-use properties in the Washington, DC market, today announced that its Board of Trustees has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.175 per common share. The dividend will be paid on January 13, 2026 to common shareholders of record as of December 30, 2025.

content.title: JBG SMITH Declares a Quarterly Common Dividend of $0.175 Per Share
content.summary: BETHESDA, Md., December 16, 2025--JBG SMITH (NYSE: JBGS), a leading owner, operator, and developer of mixed-use properties in the Washington, DC market, today announced that its Board of Trustees has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.175 per common share. The dividend will be paid on January 13, 2026 to common shareholders of record as of December 30, 2025.

headline: US Threatens to Retaliate Against EU Firms Over Digital Tax
summary: ‚ÄúIf the EU and EU Member States insist on continuing to restrict, limit, and deter the competitiveness of U.S. service providers through discriminatory means, the United States will have no choice but to begin using every tool at its disposal to counter these unreasonable measures,‚Äù the Office of the US Trade Representative said in a social media post on Tuesday.  The USTR named several other European companies, including DHL Group, SAP SE, Amadeus IT Group SA, Capgemini SE, Publicis Groupe and Mistral AI, which it said have enjoyed unfettered access to the US market for years.

content.title: US Threatens to Retaliate Against EU Firms Over Digital Tax
content.summary: ‚ÄúIf the EU and EU Member States insist on continuing to restrict, limit, and deter the competitiveness of U.S. service providers through discriminatory means, the United States will have no choice but to begin using every tool at its disposal to counter these unreasonable measures,‚Äù the Office of the US Trade Representative said in a social media post on Tuesday.  The USTR named several other European companies, including DHL Group, SAP SE, Amadeus IT Group SA, Capgemini SE, Publicis Groupe and Mistral AI, which it said have enjoyed unfettered access to the US market for years.

headline: Phil and Penny Knight's donation tops the Chronicle of Philanthropy's list of 2025's biggest gifts
summary: Topping the list was $2 billion from Nike co-founder Phil Knight and his wife, Penny, followed by a $746.7 million donation from Warren Buffett and a $500 million pledge from the mother and stepfather of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.  Nearly 40% of the $5 billion total came from the Knights‚Äô gift to Oregon Health & Science University.  More than $1.3 billion, or about one-quarter of the total, came from four donations to Buffett family foundations.

content.title: Phil and Penny Knight's donation tops the Chronicle of Philanthropy's list of 2025's biggest gifts
content.summary: Topping the list was $2 billion from Nike co-founder Phil Knight and his wife, Penny, followed by a $746.7 million donation from Warren Buffett and a $500 million pledge from the mother and stepfather of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.  Nearly 40% of the $5 billion total came from the Knights‚Äô gift to Oregon Health & Science University.  More than $1.3 billion, or about one-quarter of the total, came from four donations to Buffett family foundations.

thumbnail.caption: FILE - Phil Knight, right, and Penny Knight, watch the first half of an NCAA college basketball game in the Phil Knight Invitational tournament in Portland, Ore., Nov. 26, 2017. (AP Photo/Craig Mitchelldyer, File)

headline: Appspace Delivers Enterprise-Ready Digital Signage on Amazon Signage Stick
summary: High hardware costs, unreliable devices, and complex deployment processes have limited organizations' ability to scale digital signage. Appspace is addressing these challenges with new compatibility for the Amazon Signage Stick, giving organizations an affordable, professional-grade option for workplace signage that is simple to deploy and secure to manage.

content.title: Appspace Delivers Enterprise-Ready Digital Signage on Amazon Signage Stick
content.summary: High hardware costs, unreliable devices, and complex deployment processes have limited organizations' ability to scale digital signage. Appspace is addressing these challenges with new compatibility for the Amazon Signage Stick, giving organizations an affordable, professional-grade option for workplace signage that is simple to deploy and secure to manage.

thumbnail.caption: Appspace gives organizations a new way to manage the workplace experience. With the #1 platform for everything from employee comms to space reservation and digital signage, organizations can finally keep everyone in the know ‚Äì wherever they‚Äôre working. headline: E3, a Willdan Company, Publishes Study for Amazon on Rate Design to Manage Large Electric Load Growth
summary: ANAHEIM, Calif., December 16, 2025--Willdan Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: WLDN) announced today that it has released an independent study for Amazon, evaluating rate design to manage large electric load growth. The study examines how new large energy users, such as data centers, affect utilities and their customers, especially with growing demand from artificial intelligence (AI). The study provides practical guidance for regulators and energy providers as they plan for continued growth.

content.title: E3, a Willdan Company, Publishes Study for Amazon on Rate Design to Manage Large Electric Load Growth
content.summary: ANAHEIM, Calif., December 16, 2025--Willdan Group, Inc. (NASDAQ: WLDN) announced today that it has released an independent study for Amazon, evaluating rate design to manage large electric load growth. The study examines how new large energy users, such as data centers, affect utilities and their customers, especially with growing demand from artificial intelligence (AI). The study provides practical guidance for regulators and energy providers as they plan for continued growth.
